item.title: 波兰政策制定者打算进一步缓慢降息
item.description: 两位政策制定者表示，波兰在本周降息后不应急于进一步降息，因为通胀风险仍然很高。【原文：Poland shouldn’t rush to reduce interest rates further after this week’s cut because inflation risks remain high, according to two policymakers.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长雷恩称通货紧缩已步入正轨，经济增长前景趋弱
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员奥利-雷恩（Olli Rehn）表示，由于美国的关税政策，欧洲央行的前景并不明朗。【原文：The European Central Bank’s outlook is unclear because of US tariff policy, according to Governing Council member Olli Rehn.】

item.title: 台币对贸易伙伴货币汇率飙升至创纪录水平
item.description: 本周，台币对其主要贸易伙伴货币的汇率飙升至历史新高，有可能突破央行密切关注的水平。【原文：A gauge of the Taiwan dollar against its major trading partners’ currencies surged to a record high this week, threatening to breach a level closely watched by the central bank.】

item.title: 德国 DAX 指数再创新高，扭转关税退步局面
item.description: 德国 DAX 指数收复了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普贸易战引发的所有跌幅，成为首个突破 3 月份纪录高点的欧洲指数。【原文：Germany’s DAX Index became the first European gauge to surpass its March record high, recouping all declines sparked by US President Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 德国警方在 "eXch "行动中查获 3400 万欧元加密资产
item.description: 德国当局关闭了位于该国的加密货币交换服务机构 "eXch"，并扣押了价值 3400 万欧元（3800 万美元）的资产。【原文：German authorities closed down the crypto-swapping service “eXch” located in the nation and seized assets worth €34 million ($38 million).】

item.title: Adnoc Drilling 首席财务官预计今年收购额将达 5 亿美元
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国最大石油公司的钻井部门预计将在今年下半年进行三项收购，总金额约为 5 亿美元，同时将扩展技术和硬件以促进增长。【原文：The drilling unit of the United Arab Emirates’ biggest oil company expects to make three acquisitions in the second half of this year totaling about $500 million, as it expands in technology and hardware to bolster growth.】

item.title: 瑞银要求银行家停止在中国短期出差时乘坐公务机
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，瑞银集团已指示银行家们在前往中国的短期旅行中停止乘坐公务舱，以调整其全球差旅政策，并在交易缓慢的情况下削减在亚洲的成本。【原文：UBS Group AG has instructed bankers to stop flying business class on short trips to China, seeking to align its global travel policy and cut costs in Asia amid slow dealmaking, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 津巴布韦人争相投资房地产，将其作为应对经济动荡的避风港
item.description: 由于货币不确定性和经济政策的频繁转向吓跑了投资者，津巴布韦人正在抢购房产作为避风港，而此时该国股市正处于低迷状态。【原文：Zimbabweans are snapping up properties as a safe-haven against currency uncertainty and the frequent economic policy u-turns that have scared off investors, at a time when a popular hedge — the country’s stock market — is underperfoming.】

item.title: 紧张局势加剧，外资银行出售创纪录的印度主权债务
item.description: 外资银行周四抛售了创纪录数量的印度政府债券，因为与巴基斯坦日益加剧的边境冲突影响了投资者的情绪。【原文：Foreign banks sold a record amount of Indian government bonds Thursday, as a growing border conflict with Pakistan weighs on investor sentiment.】

item.title: 匈牙利通胀放缓，接近央行容忍范围
item.description: 匈牙利上个月的消费价格增长放缓幅度低于预期，接近央行容忍范围的上限。【原文：Hungary’s consumer price growth slowed less than forecast last month, edging closer to the top end of the central bank’s tolerance band.】

item.title: 挪威核心通胀超预期放缓，助推降息预期
item.description: 挪威上个月的基本通胀率放缓幅度超过预期，这增加了挪威银行在秋季到来之前降息的可能性。【原文：Norway’s underlying inflation slowed more than forecast last month, raising the chances of an interest-rate cut by Norges Bank before the fall.】

item.title: 据称苏尼尔-米塔尔准备购买海尔印度公司 20 亿美元的股份
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，苏尼尔-米塔尔（Sunil Mittal）正在就收购中国海尔智能家居有限公司印度分公司 49% 的股份进行深入谈判，这位亿万富翁希望利用南亚国家对家电等商品日益增长的需求。【原文：Sunil Mittal is in advanced talks to acquire a 49% stake in the Indian unit of China’s Haier Smart Home Co., according to people familiar with the matter, as the billionaire looks to tap growing demand for goods such as home appliances in the South Asian country.】

item.title: 前诺斯沃尔特首席执行官为制造业人工智能初创公司获得新资金
item.description: 破产电池制造商 Northvolt AB 公司的两名前高管在瑞典创办了一家新企业，该企业将利用人工智能帮助生产流程。【原文：Two former executives from bankrupt battery maker Northvolt AB have launched a new venture in Sweden that will utilize artificial intelligence to help manufacturing processes.】

item.title: 国际航空集团从波音和空中客车公司订购 71 架大型喷气机，以扩大航线网络
item.description: 国际航空集团（IAG SA）宣布订购一架大型宽体喷气式飞机，加倍努力发展长途运输业务，该业务为其盈利提供了动力，并帮助该航空集团升级旧机型。【原文：IAG SA announced a major aircraft order for widebody jets, doubling down on a long-haul business that’s powered its earnings and helps the airline group upgrade from older models.】

item.title: 欧洲企业在分析师电话会议上表达不确定性达到顶峰
item.description: 欧洲企业对前景的信心至少是二十年来最低的，因为它们正试图在贸易战中取得进展。【原文：Europe’s companies are the least confident about the outlook in at least two decades as they try to navigate through the trade war.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市两天下跌后有望上涨
台积电四月销售额因美国关税刺激设备抢购而激增
item.description: 台湾积体电路制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.’s revenue jumped 48% in April, underscoring how electronics firms scrambled to acquire essential components before global tariffs took effect.】

item.title: 贸易战中德国商业银行拨备增幅低于预期
item.description: 德国商业银行（Commerzbank AG）第一季度利润意外增长，原因是这家德国贷款机构在贸易战中为变质贷款预留的资金少于预期。【原文：Commerzbank AG’s first-quarter profit unexpectedly rose as the German lender set aside less money than expected for souring loans amid the trade war.】

item.title: 肯尼亚 Safaricom 公司利润增长 11%，超出预期
item.description: Safaricom Plc 表示，截至 3 月的年度利润增长了 11%，超出了分析师的预期。【原文：Safaricom Plc said annual profit rose 11% for the year ended March, exceeding analysts’ expectations.】

item.title: 随着旅游业的蓬勃发展，日本顶级酒店因可能存在价格串通而受到审查
item.description: 日本反垄断监督机构在一份警告中称，包括东京历史悠久的帝国酒店和新大谷酒店在内的一批日本顶级酒店一直在共享房价信息，这可能违反了反垄断规则。【原文：A group of Japan’s top hotels, including Tokyo’s historic Imperial Hotel and New Otani, have been sharing rates information in a potential breach of anti-monopoly rules, the country’s antitrust watchdog said in a warning.】

item.title: 阿布扎比 IHC 和贝莱德推出价值 10 亿美元的再保险公司
item.description: 阿布扎比最大的上市公司阿布扎比国际控股公司（International Holding Co.【原文：International Holding Co., Abu Dhabi’s largest listed company led by a key member of the emirate’s royal family, is launching a $1 billion reinsurance venture with BlackRock Inc.】

item.title: 杰富瑞称：借贷成本下降，香港房地产或触底反弹
item.description: 杰富瑞（Jefferies）认为，香港利率的下降增加了住宅房地产市场触底反弹的可能性。【原文：Declining interest rates in Hong Kong are increasing the chances the residential property market bottoms out, according to Jefferies.】

item.title: 北欧领导人与特朗普、泽连斯基谈论停火前景
item.description: 北欧、波罗的海和荷兰政府领导人与唐纳德-特朗普和沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基就乌克兰停火前景举行了会谈。【原文：The Nordic, Baltic and Dutch government leaders have held talks with Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskiy about the prospects of a cease fire in Ukraine.】

item.title: 中国顶级芯片制造商中芯国际预计销售额下降后暴跌
item.description: 周五，中国领先的芯片制造商中芯国际集成电路制造有限公司（Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp.【原文：Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp. plunged Friday after China’s leading chipmaker warned sales could fall as much as 6% this quarter because of production disruptions.】

item.title: 印度中央银行准备在卢比下滑时稳定其汇率
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印度央行预计卢比不会大幅波动，但准备动用外汇储备来维护货币稳定，因为与巴基斯坦的紧张局势正在升级。【原文：India’s central bank doesn’t expect wild swings in the rupee but is ready to use foreign reserves to preserve currency stability as tensions with Pakistan escalate, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: NTT 宣布回购 2,000 亿日元，改变资本战略
item.description: 日本电信电话公司（Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp.）表示，该公司计划回购多达 2,000 亿日元（14 亿美元）的自有股票，加入了越来越多的此类支持日本市场措施的行列。【原文：Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp. said it plans to buy back as much as ¥200 billion ($1.4 billion) of its own shares, joining a growing string of such measures bolstering the Japanese market.】

item.title: 中美谈判前投资者转向谨慎，中国股市下滑
item.description: 中国股市走低，原因是在全球最大的两个经济体于周末举行贸易谈判之前，市场普遍持谨慎态度。【原文：Chinese shares edged lower as caution prevailed ahead of the closely watched weekend trade talks between the world’s two largest economies.】

item.title: 私人信贷投资者在关税担忧中调整投资组合
item.description: 随着全球关税战的升级，私人信贷投资者正寻求重新调整其投资组合，因为他们越来越担心对美国的投资配置。【原文：Private credit investors are seeking to reshuffle their portfolios as the escalating global tariff war prompts mounting fears over allocations into the US.】

item.title: 中国茶壶购买罕见的穆尔班油，以便快速交货
item.description: 至少有两家独立的中国炼油厂罕见地涉足了更广泛的国际原油市场，抢购了一批将于下月交货的中东石油。【原文：At least two independent Chinese refiners have made a rare foray into the broader international crude market, snapping up cargoes of Middle Eastern oil for delivery next month.】

item.title: 财富管理公司以 60% 的收入分成吸引印度银行家
item.description: 印度一家市值 60 亿美元的基金管理公司计划加大对高级银行家的招聘力度，允许他们保留最多 60% 的收入，这表明在全球增长最快的财富市场之一，人才竞争正在白热化。【原文：A $6 billion Indian money manager plans to ramp up hiring of senior bankers by allowing them to keep up to 60% of the revenue they bring in, showing how competition for talent is heating up in one of the world’s fastest growing wealth markets.】
